title: Rough volatility: fact or artefact?. (arXiv:2203.13820v3 [q-fin.ST] UPDATED)
abstract: We investigate the statistical evidence for the use of `rough' fractional processes with Hurst exponent $H< 0.5$ for the modeling of volatility of financial assets, using a model-free approach. We introduce a non-parametric method for estimating the roughness of a function based on discrete sample, using the concept of normalized $p$-th variation along a sequence of partitions. We investigate the finite sample performance of our estimator for measuring the roughness of sample paths of stochastic processes using detailed numerical experiments based on sample paths of fractional Brownian motion and other fractional processes. We then apply this method to estimate the roughness of realized volatility signals based on high-frequency observations. translated_title: 粗糙波动：事实还是人工？（arXiv:2203.13820v3 [q-fin.ST] UPDATED）
translated_abstract: 我们使用无模型方法，调查了使用Hurst指数为$H<0.5$的“粗糙”分数过程来建模金融资产波动性的统计证据。我们引入了一种非参数方法，基于离散样本来估计函数的粗糙度，使用沿着序列分区的标准化$p$-th变异的概念。我们通过基于分数布朗运动和其他分数过程的样本路径的详细数值实验，研究了我们估计器测量随机过程样本路径的粗糙度的有限样本性能。然后，我们应用这种方法来估计基于高频观测的实现波动性信号的粗糙度。基于随机波动模型的详细数值实验表明，即使瞬时波动性具有与布朗运动相同的粗糙度的扩散动力学，实现波动性也表现出对应的粗糙行为。
tldr: 该论文调查了使用Hurst指数为$H<0.5$的粗糙分数过程建模金融资产波动性的统计证据，并提出了一种非参数方法来估计波动性信号的粗糙度。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the statistical evidence for using 'rough' fractional processes with Hurst exponent $H<0.5$ to model the volatility of financial assets, and introduces a non-parametric method for estimating the roughness of volatility signals.
